ComputeWeightedNormals(Mesh)

Computes Mesh normals weighted by the face angle at each vertex Mesh weighted normals implemented from the tips at the folowing pages: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/25100120/how-does-blender-calculate-vertex-normals http://www.bytehazard.com/articles/vertnorm.html

Declaration
public static Vector3d[] ComputeWeightedNormals(Mesh mesh)
Parameters
Type Name Description
Rhino.Geometry.Mesh mesh
Returns
Type Description
Rhino.Geometry.Vector3d[]

IsPointInMesh(Mesh, Point3d, Double)

Checks if point P is inside a Mesh by checking angle of projection vector with face normal

Declaration
public static bool IsPointInMesh(Mesh mesh, Point3d testPoint, double searchDist)
Parameters
Type Name Description
Rhino.Geometry.Mesh mesh
Rhino.Geometry.Point3d testPoint

the point to check
System.Double searchDist

maximum distance for inclusion check
Returns
Type Description
System.Boolean

true if point is inside the mesh
Remarks

This returns some false positives - use Mesh.IsPointInside() native function instead

MeshOffsetWeightedAngle(Mesh, Double)

Improves Mesh Offset using a bespoke method for Mesh normal calculation, based on face angle weighing reference: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/25100120/how-does-blender-calculate-vertex-normals and: http://www.bytehazard.com/articles/vertnorm.html

Declaration
public static Mesh MeshOffsetWeightedAngle(Mesh mesh, double offsetDistance)
Parameters
Type Name Description
Rhino.Geometry.Mesh mesh
System.Double offsetDistance
Returns
Type Description
Rhino.Geometry.Mesh

An offset Mesh
Remarks

This method generates better offset meshes in most cases (concave, convex, comples shapes, etc.)
